column2: Sisanda had a special treat – her parents got permission for her to have a party at the game reserve. The giraffes at the reserve were curious about this group of people. They stretched out their long necks for the best view of the party and they even seemed to want some of the birthday cake! Sisanda loved the giraffes. All animals were special to her
column3: but it was the quiet and gentle giraffes that stole her heart. She could spend all day watching them. One Friday
column4: Sisanda's father came home from work early. He looked very upset. "What's wrong
column5: Baba?" Sisanda asked. "Today a swarm of bees stung a mother giraffe
column6: explained Sisanda's father. Her head was so swollen from all the stings that her beautiful eyes were closed. We tried everything to help her
column7: but it was no use – she died. And the saddest part of all is that she had a young calf that still needs her."
